attributes.action: increase Income Support and Pension Credit to the amount of the "poverty line"; and NETT minimum wages to 5% more than this
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Increasing nett minimum pay to the "poverty line" plus 5% would, of course, have to be done via tax allowances.  These could be paid for by MASSIVELY increasing taxes for people paid, for instance, over £50,000 or £100,000 a year (almost £1,000 or £2,000 a week).

The main reason for this petition is that some time ago I read that the "poverty line" for childless couples was £214 a week; yet Pension Credit for a couple is £181.70.  (I imagine that Income Support for a childless couple is considerably less than that).  If £214 (for a childless couple; obviously it would be more or less than that according to individual circumstances) is the "poverty line" - i.e., presumably, the level below which one is considered to be impoverished - surely it is the minimum amount everyone should be entitled to.
